title: June Power Rankings: Top 5 Bike EXIF Custom Motorcycles
description: June brought some serious heat to Bike EXIF, with standout Harley, BMW and Ducati builds along with a unique lifestyle piece on knives that captured the attention of motorcycle enthusiasts around the globe. These are the top five Bike EXIF articles from June 2025 based on reader engagement, visual impact and social shareability. #1 – Noise Cycles’ Harley-Davidson 120R WR Replica Leading this month’s lineup is a jaw-dropping WR replica from Noise Cycles, based on a Screamin’ Eagle Harley-Davidson 120R crate motor. This machine channels the spirit of vintage board track racing with a stripped-down silhouette, hand-crafted components and a big-twin powerplant that demands respect. It’s a showcase of how heritage and high performance can meet in a raw, mechanical masterpiece.…
author: Alfonso Paca
excerpt: Neck breakers from Noise, Wedge, Prism and more that dominated our stats.
text: POSTED 06/23/2025 June brought some serious heat to Bike EXIF, with standout Harley, BMW and Ducati builds along with a unique lifestyle piece on knives that captured the attention of motorcycle enthusiasts around the globe. These are the top five Bike EXIF articles from June 2025 based on reader engagement, visual impact and social shareability. #1 – Noise Cycles’ Harley-Davidson 120R WR Replica Leading this month’s lineup is a jaw-dropping WR replica from Noise Cycles, based on a Screamin’ Eagle Harley-Davidson 120R crate motor. This machine channels the spirit of vintage board track racing with a stripped-down silhouette, hand-crafted components and a big-twin powerplant that demands respect. It’s a showcase of how heritage and high performance can meet in a raw, mechanical masterpiece. #2 – Knives for Motorcycle Riders Second on our list is a gear guide aimed squarely at two-wheeled adventurers. Whether you’re hitting the backcountry or just need a reliable everyday carry, this curated list of knives for motorcycle riders includes everything from minimalist folders to rugged fixed blades. It’s a break from bike builds that still speaks to the practical needs of riders. #3 – Prism Supply Co.’s Classic Harley Panhead Chopper Coming in strong at number three is a vintage-style Harley-Davidson Panhead chopper by Prism Supply Co. This rigid-frame build is a time capsule of 1970s Americana, complete with a springer front end and hand-crafted components throughout. It’s a soulful tribute to the golden age of chopper culture, executed with modern skill and vintage heart. #4 – BMW R80 Café Racer by Earth Motorcycles This minimalist BMW R80 café racer by Earth Motorcycles grabs fourth place. Known for their clean, functional designs, Earth has transformed this airhead into a refined modern classic. With tasteful mods, subtle finishes and a stance performance stance, it’s the kind of bike build that appeals to purists and modern custom fans alike. #5 – Ducati Scrambler 1100 by Wedge Motorcycle Rounding out the rankings is this bold and futuristic take on the Ducati Scrambler 1100 by Japan’s Wedge Motorcycle. Known for pushing boundaries, Wedge stripped this Ducati down to its essentials and rebuilt it with artistic lines, a floating tail section and industrial styling. It’s a functional concept that challenges traditional motorcycle builds. SHARE THIS ARTICLE READ NEXT
html:
POSTED 06/23/2025

June brought some serious heat to Bike EXIF, with standout Harley, BMW and Ducati builds along with a unique lifestyle piece on knives that captured the attention of motorcycle enthusiasts around the globe. These are the top five Bike EXIF articles from June 2025 based on reader engagement, visual impact and social shareability.

#1 – Noise Cycles’ Harley-Davidson 120R WR Replica

Leading this month’s lineup is a jaw-dropping WR replica from Noise Cycles, based on a Screamin’ Eagle Harley-Davidson 120R crate motor. This machine channels the spirit of vintage board track racing with a stripped-down silhouette, hand-crafted components and a big-twin powerplant that demands respect. It’s a showcase of how heritage and high performance can meet in a raw, mechanical masterpiece.

#2 – Knives for Motorcycle Riders

Second on our list is a gear guide aimed squarely at two-wheeled adventurers. Whether you’re hitting the backcountry or just need a reliable everyday carry, this curated list of knives for motorcycle riders includes everything from minimalist folders to rugged fixed blades. It’s a break from bike builds that still speaks to the practical needs of riders.

#3 – Prism Supply Co.’s Classic Harley Panhead Chopper

Coming in strong at number three is a vintage-style Harley-Davidson Panhead chopper by Prism Supply Co. This rigid-frame build is a time capsule of 1970s Americana, complete with a springer front end and hand-crafted components throughout. It’s a soulful tribute to the golden age of chopper culture, executed with modern skill and vintage heart.

#4 – BMW R80 Café Racer by Earth Motorcycles

This minimalist BMW R80 café racer by Earth Motorcycles grabs fourth place. Known for their clean, functional designs, Earth has transformed this airhead into a refined modern classic. With tasteful mods, subtle finishes and a stance performance stance, it’s the kind of bike build that appeals to purists and modern custom fans alike.

#5 – Ducati Scrambler 1100 by Wedge Motorcycle

Rounding out the rankings is this bold and futuristic take on the Ducati Scrambler 1100 by Japan’s Wedge Motorcycle. Known for pushing boundaries, Wedge stripped this Ducati down to its essentials and rebuilt it with artistic lines, a floating tail section and industrial styling. It’s a functional concept that challenges traditional motorcycle builds.
